html:
Nov 29 (Reuters) - Securities analysts revised their ratings and price targets on several European companies, including A.P. Moller-Maersk, Homeserve and Swiss Prime Site AG, on Monday.


HIGHLIGHTS

* A.P. Moller-Maersk MAERSKb.CO: JP Morgan raises to overweight from neutral

* Flughafen Zuerich AG FHZN.S: Credit Suisse assumes coverage with neutral rating

* Homeserve HSV.L: HSBC raises to hold from reduce

* PSP Swiss Property AG PSPN.S: Credit Suisse assumes coverage with neutral rating

* Swiss Prime Site AG SPSN.S: Credit Suisse assumes coverage with neutral rating

Following is a summary of research actions on European companies reported by Reuters on Monday. Stock entries are in alphabetical order.


* 3I Group III.L: Morgan Stanley raises target price to 1723p from 1591p

* A.G. Barr BAG.L: Peel Hunt raises to buy from add

* A.P. Moller-Maersk MAERSKb.CO: Citigroup raises PT to DKK 25,000 from DKK 23,500

* A.P. Moller-Maersk MAERSKb.CO: JP Morgan raises target to DKK 26,965 from DKK 22,600

* A.P. Moller-Maersk MAERSKb.CO: JP Morgan raises to overweight from neutral

* Abrdn Plc ABDN.L: Morgan Stanley cuts target price to 266p from 289p

* Abrdn Plc ABDN.L: Morgan Stanley cuts to underweight from equal weight

* Amadeus AMA.MC: UBS raises to buy from neutral; raises target to EUR 70 from EUR 65

* Amundi SA AMUN.PA: Morgan Stanley cuts to equal weight from overweight
